body:
> Ok, the theory is that the dedup queue for the Async Stages skip some of the EV update.
> This happens after we greatly boost pipeline speed. So it is possible that during the 1st EV update event is processing, the 2nd EV update event is still in the dedup queue. Then we started to remove the resource. The corresponding EV update event (3rd) is deduped. Same situation might happen for the other EV update events.
> 
> Given the cached data in the ClusterEvent object won't be refreshed when the EV update event is picked up, I don't think we should use dedup queue for this specific Stage at least.

Since the dedup queue actually dedups the prior events, there is no concern that the newer event is ignored. And since all Helix logic assume that a later operation can resolve and catch up data gaps between different notifications, so there is no real logic problem here.

Thanks all for reviewing this PR! Rebased to TOT master and waiting for CI to complete.

This PR is ready to be merged.  Approved by @jiajunwang 
Final commit message:
New REST api partitionAssignment -- return potential assignment given cluster change
This PR is ready to be merged.

Overall considering the codes in this PR looks good to me. The question that I have is about the controller leadership change. If in management mode, the new controller gets the leadership, then how management pipeline would run?

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @zhangmeng916.

**Commit message:**

Change partition status in Helix UI to be colorblind-friendly 

This commit changes the partition status colors in Helix UI from green/orange to blue(#2196F3)/black(#212121) to be more colorblind-friendly. The colors are chosen such that they have a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against each other and the background. Moreover, a checkmark is placed in the icon for ready status, and an exclamation point for the not-ready status.

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang 

Management mode operation history needs to be persisted to the controller history znode. The status of IN_PROGRESS or COMPLETED is recorded in the temporary status znode: /{clusterName}/STATUS/CLUSTER/{clusterName}.
This commit adds data model and methods to record the status and history for management mode.

> LGTM. There are similar mixed usages in PropertyKey.java. Do we want to also clean them?

I see. But since it is clean (all using static import), I think there is no point in changing it now. Once we decide to have a very strict code convention regarding the import, we shall change it.
Approved by @huizhilu , I will merge soon.

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @junkaixue @alirezazamani @jiajunwang 
I will merge it later.

Management Mode Pipeline will help check the cluster status and determine whether the default pipelines can be run.
One use case is, it will help controller to decide when it can exit the cluster freeze mode.

This commit adds management mode pipeline and logic to switch from/to the default resource/task pipelines.
Approved by @junkaixue . I will merge the PR soon.

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @jiajunwang 

Final commit message:
Support currentState format for partitionAssignment.

> The change looks good. But there are no tests. Are you planning to add in the next PR?

The existing tests cover the logic of maintenance and cluster status monitoring. Will add unit/integration tests in later PRs.

This PR is ready to be merged.

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @jiajunwang 

Commit message:
Add failure message for TestClusterAccessor

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @alirezazamani 

Message creation methods are private in message generation phase. Management mode stage will also need message generation methods to create ST cancellation and participant status change messages.
Message util will help with the purposes.

This commit moves the common message creation logic to a message util so multiple stages can reuse the code.

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @alirezazamani 
I will merge it a bit later.

Controller needs to know the participant freeze status so it can send freeze/unfreeze messages for entering/exiting freeze mode. The status check is done in management mode stage.

This commit adds methods to check cluster management mode status, and update the status and history accordingly.
Overall, it looks good to me. Please resolve JJ's comments.
I will take this issue. THX~
This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @alirezazamani

> I have a general question, what is the reason to have the header value in the response?

Thanks for the question.
When user call this API in async mode, we need to add some metadata info in the reply indicating the return format/filter value etc. 
Usually metadata stores in header instead of payload.
This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @junkaixue

Sync up with @xyuanlu . Following actions needed:
1. Add comments for the suggestion of leveraging header to store metadata.
2. Think about what we can do that let existing customers know the header has info can be retrieved as well. I think most of our customers only relying on the payload returned by REST service.
I believe this failure is related to https://github.com/apache/helix/issues/1810.

> @xyuanlu any update on this?

Thanks for the review.
I have updated the PR. I plan to update the REST API document after this PR is merged. And maybe propose to evaluate all current APIs to see if we pass any metadata in response body (that may need to be reconstructed).

Thanks!
One question: Task Current State operations will not be affected?

> One question: Task Current State operations will not be affected?

@alirezazamani Thanks for the review. Right, Task won't be affected. Freeze mode doesn't apply to TASK pipeline.
This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @junkaixue @alirezazamani @xyuanlu
This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang 

I'll merge it later tonight after running one more time tests in helix-core.

Approved by @junkaixue. I will merge soon.

The failure CI test is a known issue that has been tracked by unstable test issue https://github.com/apache/helix/issues/1786

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang      
Final commit message:
## Fix TestZkConnectionLost ##
Fix TestZkConnectionLost by adding longer connection timeout and fixing logic that are incorrect.

Commit message:

Thanks!!

Approved by @NealSun96 , I will merge it once the test pass. It failed due to some unstable tests.

Test TestRoutingTableProviderFromTargetEV.testExternalViewDiffFromTargetExternalView is not stable recently. Tracked in #1825. The same test failure is observed on the master branch.
I will move forward since this PR is pure code style/document changes.

This PR is ready to be merged.
Commit message: 
Stabilize TestInstancesAccessor

TestInstancesAccessor is unstable because the cluster might not be
stable while the test runs the stoppable check and cluster config and
instance config can be missing. In this commit, the test waits until the
cluster config and instance config get created and then proceeds for
the stoppable checks.

@ritesh-kapoor are you using the FULL_AUTO mode for helix? If yes, you can change you number of partitions and Helix will automatically generate new partitions. 

For the underneath partition index is generated by you application.
We do not have plan to do the upgrade right now. Close it.
